thread.title: Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: Rahul Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, Amit Shah to hold road shows in Allahabad
thread.title_full: Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: Rahul Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, Amit Shah to hold road shows in Allahabad

author: FE Online
title: Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: Rahul Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, Amit Shah to hold road shows in Allahabad
text:
Uttar pradesh assembly elections 2017 Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: Rahul Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, Amit Shah to hold road shows in Allahabad Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 Live Updates: Rahul Gandhi, Akhilesh Yadav, Amit Shah to hold road shows in Allahabad The curtain will come down on high-decibel campaign for the fourth phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 on Tuesday. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Updated: February 21, 2017 11:00 AM The curtain will come down on high-decibel campaign for the fourth phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 on Tuesday. 
The curtain will come down on high-decibel campaign for the fourth phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly Elections 2017 on Tuesday. 53 assembly seats will go to polls on February 23. BJP led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi has taken on Samajwadi Party- Congress alliance by unleashing a number of jibes at Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav and Rahul Gandhi . BSP led by Maywati is trying to reach out to voters. The assembly constituencies are spread over 12 districts of Uttar Pradesh- include Congress president Sonia Gandhi ’s Rae Bareli, Allahabad, Pratapgarh, Jhansi, Lalitpur, Mahoba, Banda, Hamirpur, Chitrakoot and Fatehpur. A total of 630 candidates, including 50 women, are in fray in this fourth phase of elections. 
The battle for the throne of politically crucial state, heated up with Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav appealing ‘Sadi ke Mahanayak’ (without actually naming Amitabh Bachchan ) not to campaign for Gujarat ‘donkeys.’“I would like to request the ‘mahanayak’ of the century (Amitabh Bachchan) not to campaign for donkeys of Gujarat. Those who have seen the advertisement will understand whom we are talking about,” Akhilesh said. 
While launching a scathing attack on rival political parties, PM Narendra Modi had said that post three phases of assembly polls, it has become evident that the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) will form government in Uttar Pradesh, adding that the Samajwadi Party, Congress and the Bahujan Samaj Party are now toiling hard to woo voters in order to save their respect. 
10:58 am: BJP President Amit Shah will hold roadshow in Allahabad. 
10:57 am : Congress vice president Rahul Gandhi and Chief Minister Akhilesh Yadav will hold roadshow in Allahabad.
